instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-4924: What is 820-4924? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.PP5V_S5: What is PP5V_S5? This is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state..
definitions.PPVRTC_G3H: What is PPVRTC_G3H? PPVRTC_G3H is a 3.3v power rail for the RTC circuit present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state. .
definitions.PPDCIN_G3H: What is PPDCIN_G3H? PPDCIN_G3H Is a power rail that comes directly from the laptop charger..
definitions.PP3V3_SUS: What is PP3V3_SUS? The "PP3V3_SUS" rail on a MacBook logic board is a power rail that provides a 3.3-volt supply to the suspend-to-RAM (S3 state) components. .
definitions.PPDCIN_G3H_ISOL: What is PPDCIN_G3H_ISOL? This is the voltage coming directly from the charger after going through a transistor. .
definitions.PP1V05_SUS: What is PP1V05_SUS? The PP1V05_SUS signal in the MacBook schematic is a power rail that supplies 1.05 volts, typically used in a suspended (SUS) state of the laptop. This state is a low-power mode where essential system functions are maintained, but the majority of the system is powered down..
definitions.U7501: What is U7501? This chip is often responsible for creating PP3V3_S5,  PP3V3_S3,  PP3V3_S0,  PP5V_S5,  PP5V_S4,  PP5V_S0.
definitions.PP5V_S3: What is PP5V_S3? PP5V_S3 is a 5v power rail present when the system is in an S3 suspend to RAM state..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 2015 Retina 13in green light on charger no power on need some help
threads.message:
Hi guys, I'm working on a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board green light on charger, unit will not power on no obvious shorts to ground i cant get it to turn on any ideas here are my readings im confused about <SIGNAL>PPBUS_S4</SIGNAL> rail is that normal?

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>    12.58V
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_S5_HS_COMPUTING</SIGNAL> 12.58
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_S5_HS_OTHER5V</SIGNAL>  12.58
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_S5_HS_OTHER3V3</SIGNAL>  12.58
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_S4_X239</SIGNAL>  0.00
<SIGNAL>PPVIN_S4_TPAD</SIGNAL>  0.00
<SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H_ISOL</SIGNAL>  15.17
<SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL>    14.59
<SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL>    3.41
<SIGNAL>PPVRTC_G3H</SIGNAL>   3.34


<SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL>  5.024
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> 3.348
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_SUS</SIGNAL>   3.347
<SIGNAL>PP1V05_SUS</SIGNAL>   1.060

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 2015 Retina 13in green light on charger no power on need some help
threads.message: Check S3 busses for pulsing/power cycling, preferably use a scope because the pulses are only a few milliseconds. Also history?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 2015 Retina 13in green light on charger no power on need some help
threads.message:
[QUOTE="dukefawks, post: 5428"]Check S3 busses for pulsing/power cycling, preferably use a scope because the pulses are only a few milliseconds. Also history?[/QUOTE]

<SIGNAL>PP5V_S3</SIGNAL> reg shows no voltage on the meter on the scope i get 3.4v on pin 2 of <CHIP>U7501</CHIP> without grounding the circuit when i ground it i get 0v im confused customer stated just stopped working

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 2015 Retina 13in green light on charger no power on need some help
threads.message: PPDCIN shows 14.6V? Are you using a 45W charger? It MUST be 60W or higher.
